div.l: They told every man that he was wood
So he was a gast of Noyis flood
Thorowe Fantesy that of his vanite
He had I bout hym kneding tubbis thre
And had hem hangid in the rofe above
And that he preid hym for Goddis love
To syttyn in the rofe ꝑpar company
The folk gan laghen at his fantzy
In to the rofe they kykyn and þey gape
And turnyd al his harm in to a Iape
For what so evir this Carpent̉er answerd
Hit was for noght no man his reson herd
With othis grete he was swore a down
That he was hold wood in al the Town
For every Clerk held hem with othir
They seid þe man was wode my leve brothir
And every white gan laghe at þis stryfe
Thus swyvid was the Carpenteris wyfe
For al his keping and al his Ielowsy
And Absolou hath kyssid her nethir ye
And Nycholas is skaldit in the tout
This tale is done and God save al þe rowte
¶ Here endith the millere his tale
And here begynneyth the Reve his Prolog
When folk had laughyn̄ at þis nyce case
Of Absolon̄ and of Nycholase
Diverce folk diủersly they seydyn̄
But for the more part they loghe ⁊and pleydyn̄
Ne at his tale I save no man hym greve
But it were only Oswold the Reve
Be cause he was of Carpenteris craft
Alitel Ire in his hert is laft
He gan to gruch and blame it alite
Sithe quod he Ful wele I coude þe quyte
With blering of a prowde myllerris ye
Yf þat me list to speke of rebawdry
